intro: Gaertnera pongatii, commonly known as the Pongatii hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and requires well-draining soil. Gaertnera pongatii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display.
